content.en: Ad-hoc network optimization: Researchers have been exploring ways to improve the efficiency and performance of ad-hoc networks using algorithms. One approach is the use of adaptive routing protocols, such as the Signal-Power Adaptive Fast Rerouting (SPAFAR) protocol, which employs efficient route discovery and maintenance mechanisms. Another strategy is the implementation of Quality-of-Service (QoS) routing protocols, which calculate end-to-end bandwidth and utilize route discovery mechanisms to improve throughput and delay in mobile ad hoc networks. These algorithms take advantage of factors like node location information and non-homogeneous properties of nodes to optimize routes and provide reliable service.
content.da: Ad-hoc netværksoptimering: Forskere har undersøgt måder at forbedre effektiviteten og ydeevnen i ad-hoc netværk ved hjælp af algoritmer. En tilgang er brugen af adaptive routingprotokoller, såsom Signal-Power Adaptive Fast Rerouting (SPAFAR) protokollen, der anvender effektive mekanismer til rutefindning og -vedligeholdelse. En anden strategi er implementeringen af Quality-of-Service (QoS) routingprotokoller, der beregner end-to-end båndbredde og bruger rutefindingsmekanismer til at forbedre gennemløb og forsinkelse i mobile ad-hoc netværk. Disse algoritmer udnytter faktorer som nodepositioninformation og ikke-homogene egenskaber ved noder til at optimere ruter og levere pålidelig service.
